class_e_07_battle_01:
Osu! This is our last class, but don’t let those
energy levels drop before we wrap things up![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_02:
You’ve shown that you have more than enough
knowledge to be superstrong battlers![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_03: I don’t know that I have much left to teach you...[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_04: but we can always aim for ever-greater heights![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_05:
So today, I’m going to teach you about the rules
of Link Battles![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_06:
When two Trainers participate in Link Battles
together, they can engage in either Single Battles\r
or Double Battles with each other![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_07:
And if you’re playing in a group of four, you can
all battle each other in Multi Battles![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_08:
Now, when you’re out having battles during your
independent study, you can use whatever number\r
of Pokémon you like—and they can be any level![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_09:
But, in Link Battles, there are special rules to
keep in mind.[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_10:
Some of these special rules involve adjusting
Pokémon’s levels![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_11:
Now, the [VAR COLOR(0006)]No Restrictions [VAR COLOR(0000)]rule set lets all Pokémon
stay at their current level.\c
It lets Trainers use multiple Pokémon of the same
species and multiples of the same held item, too![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_12:
But if you choose to use [VAR COLOR(0006)]Normal Rules[VAR COLOR(0000)], all
Pokémon will be set to Lv. 50 for your battles—\r
regardless of what level they actually are.[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_13:
This even includes lower-level Pokémon. They’ll
get a power boost to participate![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_14:
Normal Rules let you use multiples of the same
Pokémon species and of the same held items too.[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_15:
The great part about this rule set is that it lets
any of your Pokémon participate—all they have\r
to do is learn some good moves![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_16:
Lastly, the rule set called [VAR COLOR(0006)]Flat Rules[VAR COLOR(0000)] mostly affects
Pokémon over Lv. 50. Such Pokémon will be set\r
to Lv. 50 for the duration of the battle![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_17:
The Flat Rules rule set is the one often used for
official tournaments.[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_18:
This rule set does NOT allow Trainers to use
multiple Pokémon of the same species or\r
multiples of the same held item![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_19: All right. Here’s a question for you![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_20:
Which rule set should you pick if you want to use
a lower-level Pokémon and keep its level low?[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_answer_01:
Oooh, gotcha there! Normal Rules adjusts all
Pokémon to Lv. 50—even lower-level ones![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_answer_02:
That’s the one, new kid! Looks like you were
listening to the lesson![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_21:
If you’ve got some clever strategy that you need
to use a Lv. 5 Pokémon for, your best bet is to\r
choose the Flat Rules rule set![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_22:
Of course, you can also choose No Restrictions if
you want to battle with any Pokémon you want—\r
at any level and with any held item![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_23:
That’s a pretty good rule set for when you want
to battle freely with friends.[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_25:
Normal Rules adjusts all Pokémon to Lv. 50!\c
Flat Rules lets you use lower-level Pokémon at
their actual levels![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_26:
I hope you’ll use these tips to have some exciting
battles with your friends![VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_27:
Aw, man! I was just about to suggest we do some
hands-on practice to really drive the point home,\r
but I guess we truly are out of time...[VAR 0114(0024)]
class_e_07_battle_28:
Next class will be our final exam! Aim for a
perfect score! Osu! Osu![VAR 0114(0024)]
